result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8-8-18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8-8-18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 150 days. COURT ORDERED NO EXPUNGEMENT.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Random urine.
No tickets for possession of THC.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Jerome Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original PLEA/SENTENCING Transcript (23 pages) commencing AUGUST 8, 2014 by WILLIAM CARPENTER.
Per request of court reporter.
denied, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. spc

Count one.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Also referenced ATN #41004804604125, arrest date 3-11-14, MCSO.

Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

 Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Belea T. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for FOUR YEARS AND ONE MONTH.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of ONE  YEAR AND ONE MONTH and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of THREE  YEARS , consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 150 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8-8-18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8-8-18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment, RANDOM URINE
-No tickets for possession of THC
-Court ordered no expungment. 
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement .   lr
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea hearing scheduled for 08-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in custody.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Suppression motion proceeded. On motion of the defense, Court ordered sequestration of witnesses. Sworn in for the State:  Officer Sean Mahnke. Exhibit 1 and 2 received. Sworn in for the State:  Officer Mark Dillman. State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense rests. Testimony closed. Cause argued. Court found there was probable cause for the stop and the pat down.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
ADA is in trial on another case and there is no other ADA available to cover the Motion on a spin. Case rescheduled for MOTION HEARING on 8/7/2014 at 3:00 pm.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Evidentiary Hearing.   State is not able to proceed, the police officer had a family emergency.  Court orders hearing adjourned.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Brief in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed.
MOTION TO SUPPRESS EVIDENCE: Illegal Stop and Search of Defendant, filed by Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND filed by the defendant. sab

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Defense request for an evidentuary hearing date is granted by the court.  Defense is to file motions IN Branch 15 by 05-05-14 and the state is to respond by  05-20-14.    Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 15.  Evidentiary hearing scheduled for 05-27-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense still needs to receive an offer. Case calendared for STATUS on 4/14/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in custody.  Marissa Santiago for Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #05CF4545 that are attached to the complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sean Mahnke-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watt, Br. 15.
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Christopher Jerome Mitchell in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
